news-item.title: Denso keeps sliding: down 5.5% in 2 days
news-item.text:
Denso Corporation (TO:6902), the 3rd largest transportation equipment company by market capitalisation in the Tokyo Stock Exchange, extended its slide Monday, shedding an additional JPY80.0 (or 1.6%) to close at JPY4,949.0. The shares have sunk JPY287.0 (or 5.5%) over the past two trading days. Compared with the Nikkei 225 Index which fell 538.3 points (or 3.63%) in the two days, this represented a relative price change of -1.8%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on Denso, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/00105171177031494 Bearish SignalsDowntrend- The stock dropped 1.6% on high volatility today.- The stock dropped to a four-month low.- The stock's relative price strength percentile is slipping at 66 for 6 months, 54 for 3 months and 19 for 1 month.- The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator of 12-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA) of 5,227.7 minus the 26-day EMA of 5,289.21 is negative 61.51 suggesting a bearish signal. Both EMA prices are falling, another bearish signal. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Price/Earnings of 24.1 [18.2]. We estimate Denso stock is trading at a current year P/E of 13.7 and a forward year P/E of 7.8. - Price/Sales of 1.2 [0.7]. - Price to Book of 1.9 [1.5].Other Bearish Signals:- Net profit margin has averaged 4.2% in the last 3 years. This suggests the company is less profitable with a low margin of safety.- As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity is less than stellar at 7.9%. This is computed as net profit margin of 5.1% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 0.9 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 1.7.- Revenue growth has seen consecutive falls and seems to be on a slippery slope in recent quarters.[Quarter ended, all figures in %]
Bullish Signals- The present value of JPY1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in Denso is JPY1,212, for a capital gain of JPY212. Oversold/Bullish/Support Signals- At JPY4,949.0 the price is below the lower Bollinger band support of JPY5,057.09, indicating an upside for it to return to the band. - The Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 25.1 has breached the oversold line of 30, suggesting the price decrease of 7.8% in the last 14 days is unusually high. - The stock is oversold according to the Williams % R indicator of -94.7, suggesting the price is close to its 14-day low of JPY4,920.0.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Return on Assets 4.6% [2.9%].Other Bullish Signals:- Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 1.1. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued.- Net Profit margin is positive and has seen consecutive rises in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
NoteVolume: there were 1,741,000 shares worth JPY8.6 billion (US$85.3 million) traded. The volume was 0.7 times the average trading of 2.4 million shares. Beta: the Beta of Denso stock is 0.9. A Beta lower than 1 suggests this is a low risk, low return stock with volatility less than that of the market. - Denso is at a discount of 14.7% to its 12-month high of JPY5,799.0 on 20 Jan, 2014. It is also at a premium of 34.1% to the 12-month low of JPY3,690.0 on 02 Apr, 2013.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Parity:- Return on Equity 7.9% [8.1%].- Price/Earnings/Growth of 0.2 [0.2].
